column5: Programme descriptionThe MSc in Language and Intercultural Communication is interdisciplinary degree programme that aims to provide a pedagogically grounded and practical understanding of issues surrounding the study of language and intercultural communication.It is based on the premise that, to help learners develop into multi-lingually and multi-culturally aware world citizens, language teachers must work for maximum integration between language and culture teaching.
column7: Tuition fees vary between degree programmes. Find the specific fees for your chosen programme on our website.
column9: MSc: 1 year full-time or 2-6 years part-time; PgCert: 4 months-2 years part-time; PgDip: 9 months full-time or 1-4 years part-time
